intro: Banisteria albicana, commonly known as the white banister, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
